ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: No I would not recommend this course. If you are interested in Econometric Theorey Econometrics III is a better pick if you are interested in thorough applications or how you implement the techniques this course does not help you either.
Probably want to skip this one...
Not very applied -- includes many proofs and little data work. Students need to do a lot of the learning themselves by reading the material as lectures are not very well structured.
I would recommend if the teacher changes and if the student is clear about what the course will be about.
I would not recommend it. Better use of time to just read the textbook.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It did not deepen my knowledge of my discipline/profession in the slightest? To no extent did this course contribute to my dissertation/research.

I initially thought this would be a how-to-do-it course for applied economic research, but I was probably wrong to assume that. The course spends most time on theoretical proofs and derivations of least squares models and extremum estimators, which I think is a bit overkill for applied economists but insufficient for theorists. Moreover, I don't think I developed a solid econometrics background for applied research from this course, and probably still have to rely on independent reading to understand most of the applied econometric techniques.
gave a good overview of major methods and their shortcomings. this will be useful as i will use these methods in my future research
Material covered was relevant and helpful, teaching could be more effective and more applied.
